info.title: Virtual Agent
info.description:
Zoom Virtual Agent APIs enable you to build artificial intelligence (AI) and chatbot solutions for your website. 

 Your website users can expect immediate responses to their queries at any time. As a result, Zoom Virtual Agent deploys support to your users faster and reduces the workload for your live agents. 

 All endpoints are available through `https` at `api.zoom.us/v2/`.

get.description:
Returns multiple knowledge base articles.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:read:km_kbs`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:read:list_km_articles`,`zva:read:list_km_articles:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: kbId
parameters.description: The ID of the knowledge base

schema.description: The ID of the knowledge base.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

schema.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned per page.

schema.description: The number of records returned per page.

parameters.name: include_contents
parameters.description: Whether to include the contents of the article in the response or not.

schema.description: Whether to include the contents of the article in the response or not.

parameters.name: excluded
parameters.description: Whether to query excluded articles or not.

schema.description: Whether to query excluded articles or not.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language of the results.

200.description: The list of the returned articles.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

articles.description: The list or articles from the knowledge base

external_id.description: The external ID of the article.

kb_id.description: The ID of the knowledge base.

created_at.description: The date and time the article was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time the article was last updated.

exclude.description: Whether the article is excluded from being presented as a solution to queries.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `33001`
Specified KB is not type Custom API.
**Error Code:** `33005`
Validation failed.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `33000`
The knowledge base was not found.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Creates a knowledge base article.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:write:km_kbs`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:write:km_article`,`zva:write:km_article:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: kbId
parameters.description: The knowledge base's ID.

exclude.description: This field excludes the article from being presented as a solution to queries.

created_at.description: The date and time the article was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time the article was last updated.

exclude.description: This field excludes the article from being presented as a solution to queries.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `33001`
Specified KB is not type Custom API.
**Error Code:** `33002`
Too many articles for KB (limit is 5000).
**Error Code:** `33005`
Validation failed.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `33000`
The knowledge base was not found.

409.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `409`
Conflict **Error Code:** `33003`
An article for this KB already exists with external ID "871b707a-7756-46b6-bfba-36a297ba1e85" and language "en".

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Creates a sync request for the specified knowledge base

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:write:km_kbs`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:update:km_kb:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: kbId
parameters.description: The knowledge base's ID.

requestBody.description: Creates a sync request for the specified knowledge base.

progress_percent.description: The percent progress of the sync.

error_code.description: The numerical error code of reason why sync failed (otherwise null).

error_message.description: The error message of the reason why a sync failed (otherwise null).
error_message.example: The sync failed because no articles had any content.

created_at.description: The time the sync request was created (in ISO 8601 format).

updated_at.description: The type the sync progress or status was last updated (in ISO 8601 format).

started_at.description: The time the sync started (in ISO 8601 format).

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request Bad Request **Error Code:** `33001`
Specified KB is not type Custom API.
**Error Code:** `33013`
The knowledge base is not enabled
**Error Code:** `33005`
Validation failed.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found Not Found **Error Code:** `33000`
The knowledge base was not found.

409.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `409`
Conflict Conflict **Error Code:** `33011`
A sync is already in progress
**Error Code:** `33012`
A sync has completed too recently

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Returns the details of a knowledge base sync.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:read:km_kbs`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:read:km_kb:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: kbId
parameters.description: The ID of the knowledge base.

parameters.name: syncId
parameters.description: The ID of the sync request.

progress_percent.description: The percent progress of the sync.

error_code.description: The numerical error code of reason why sync failed (otherwise null).

error_message.description: The error message of reason why sync failed (otherwise null).
error_message.example: The sync failed because no articles had any content

created_at.description: The time the sync request was created (in ISO 8601 format).

updated_at.description: The type the sync progress or status was last updated (in ISO 8601 format).

started_at.description: The time the sync started (in ISO 8601 format).

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found Default Response **Error Code:** `33014`
The knowledge base or sync request was not found

get.description:
Generates a list of ZVA engagements.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva_report:read`,`zva_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:read:list_engagements:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, return data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: **Required** only when the **from** parameters are specified. The end time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format is the same format as the **from** parameter.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The call's [timezone ID](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/abbreviation-lists/#timezones). The default is **UTC**.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of items returned per page.
Constraints: Maximum - 100, default - 10

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. It returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: include_query_detail
parameters.description: Whether the engagement response includes query details.

parameters.name: agent_types
parameters.description: A list of (comma-separated) agent types. The default value is **chat**.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`
ZVA engagements successfully returned.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. It returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description:
The number of records returned within a single API call.
Constraints: Max: 100 Default: 10

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

start_time.description: The engagement's start time and date in **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format.

duration.description: The duration of the engagement in seconds.

global_variables.description: The information about the engagement's global variables. Marked for removal. Recommended to use the new **Variables API** instead.

need_mask.description: If the global variable needs a mask.

need_store.description: If the global variable needs a store.

launch_url.description: The URL of the transcript of the engagement, such as a link to the transcript as a secured embeddable web page.

count.description: The total count of the engagement's query IDs.

query_summary.description: The summary of queries in an engagement.

intents_matched.description: The matched custom intents in the engagement.

accuracy.description: The intent's accuracy, from 0 to 1. 0.5 means this intent has 50% accuracy.

system_intent.description: Whether this record belongs to the system intent.

count.description: The total count of the matched engagement's intents.

intent_summary.description: The summary of the matched custom intents in the engagement.

language_code.description: The language code for the engagement.

bot_id.description: The bot's ID that the engagement uses.

query_time.description: The date and time when the query started in ISO 8601 format (**yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss**).

language_code.description: The language code for the query.

intents.description: The intents associated with the query.

accuracy.description: The intent's accuracy. From 0 to 1. (e.g. 0.5 means this intent has 50% accuracy.)

system_intent.description: Whether this record belongs to the system intent.

items.description: The top intent associated with the query.

title.example: Can I edit my chat welcome screen?

answer.example: Yes, you can customize the following settings for the chat welcome screen.

kb_details.description: The article's knowledge base detail list.

items.description: The top knowledge base article associated with the query.

end_time.description: The engagement's end time and date in **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format.

consumer_id.description: The consumer iD of the engagement

deleted.description: Whether the status engagement is deleted or not.

agents.description: This list of agents involved in this engagement

agent_type.description: The type of the agent used in the engagement.

agent_id.description: The internal ID of the agent.

agent_name.description: The agent name entered by the user.

agent_version_id.description: Internal version ID of AI agent.

tools.description: The list of tools AI agent used in this engagement.

items.description: The name of the tool AI agent used in this engagement.

skills.description: The list of skills AI agent invoked in this engagement.

items.description: The name of the skill AI agent used in this engagement.

articles.description: The list of articles AI agent used in this engagement.

items.description: The title of the article AI agent used in this engagement.
items.example: Can I edit my chat welcome screen?

topics.description: The list of topics AI agent detected in this engagement.

items.description: The name of the topic AI agent used in this engagement.

last_responder.description: The entity that responded the last in this conversation.

interaction_duration.description: The total number of seconds of interaction between the AI agent and the consumer.

interaction_turns.description: The total number of conversation exchanges between the Consumer and AI Agent.

escalation_reason.description: Whether the escalation was requested or by design.

user_phone_number.description: The phone number of the user.

source_types.description: The list of sources from where the engagement originates.

items.description: The enum value for the source type.

transfer_accepted.description: Whether the transfer was accpeted by the agent or not.

implicit_resolution.description: Whether the consumer's issue was implicitly resolved by the virtual agent. **This is field is available only if it is enabled for the account.**

from.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, it returns data from the past 24 hours.

to.description: **Required** only when the **from** parameters is specified. The end time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, the same format as the **from** parameter.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1001`
User does not exist.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Returns a list of ZVA engagement query details.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva_report:read`,`zva_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:read:list_queries:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, it returns data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The field is **required** only when the **from** parameter is specified. The end time and date is in the **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, which is the same format as the **from** parameter.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The call's [timezone ID](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/abbreviation-lists/#timezones). The default is **UTC**.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of items returned per page. 
Constraints: Max: 100 Default: 10

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: engagement_ids
parameters.description: The engagement IDs string separated by ",". Up limit is 2000 characters.

parameters.name: agent_types
parameters.description: A list of (comma-separated) agent types. Default value is **chat**.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`
ZVA engagement query details successfully returned.

from.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, it returns data from the past 24 hours.

to.description: This field is **required** only when the **from** parameter is specified. The end time and date is in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, which is the same format as the **from** parameter.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call. Constraints: Max: 100 Default: 10

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

engagement_query_details.description: The list for the engagement query details.

query_details.description: The query details list that belong to the engagement.

bot_id.description: The bot's ID that the query uses. This field is available only when the agent type in the engagement is **CHAT**.

bot_name.description: The bot's name. This field is available only when the agent type in the engagement is **CHAT**.

bot_session_id.description: The bot session's ID. This field is available only when the agent type in the engagement is **CHAT**.

query_time.description: The date and time when the query started in ISO 8601 format (**yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss**).

language_code.description: The language code for the query.

intents.description: The intents associated with the query.

accuracy.description: The intent's accuracy. From 0 to 1. (e.g. 0.5 means this intent has 50% accuracy.)

system_intent.description: Whether this record belongs to the system intent.

items.description: The top intent associated with the query.

article_title.example: Can I edit my chat welcome screen?

article_answer.example: Yes, you can customize the following settings for the chat welcome screen.

kb_details.description: The list for the article's knowledge base details.

items.description: The top knowledge base article associated with the query.

deleted.description: Whether the status query is deleted or not.

topic_name.description: The name of the topic used in the query.

agent_id.description: The ID of the agent used in the query. This field is available only when the agent type in the engagement is either **AI_VOICE** or **AI_CHAT**.

agent_name.description: The name of the agent in the query. This field is available only when the agent type in the engagement is either **AI_VOICE** or **AI_CHAT**.

agent_type.description: The type of the agent used in the query. This field is available only when the agent type in the engagement is either **AI_VOICE** or **AI_CHAT**.

agent_session_id.description: The session ID of the agent in the query. This field is available only when the agent type in the engagement is either **AI_VOICE** or **AI_CHAT**.

items.description: The object for the engagement query details.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1002`
Unable to fetch query details.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `1001`
Engagement does not exist: $engagement_ids

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Get a list of ZVA engagement variable details.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva_report:read`,`zva_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:read:list_variables:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, it returns data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The field is **required** only when the **from** parameter is specified. The end time and date is in the **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, which is the same format as the **from** parameter.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The call's [timezone ID](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/abbreviation-lists/#timezones). The default is **UTC**.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of items returned per page. 
Constraints: Max: 100 Default: 10

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: engagement_ids
parameters.description: The engagement IDs string separated by ",". Up limit is 2000 characters.

parameters.name: agent_types
parameters.description: The list of (comma-separated) agent types. The default value is **chat**.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`
ZVA engagement variable details successfully returned.

from.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, it returns data from the past 24 hours.

to.description: This field is **required** only when the **from** parameter is specified. The end time and date is in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, which is the same format as the **from** parameter.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call. Constraints: Max: 100 Default: 10

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

engagement_variable_details.description: The list of engagements and its variable details.

variable_details.description: The list of variable details belonging to the given engagement ID.

type.description: The type of the variable. Type Array and Json are not stored.

value.description: The value of the variable. It is always a **string**.

need_mask.description: Whether the value of the variable needs masking to protect sensitive data.

group_id.description: The ID of the group to which the variable belongs to.

group_name.description: The name of the group to which the variable belongs to.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1002`
Unable to fetch variable details

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized Missing or invalid authentication

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `1001`
Engagement does not exist: $engagement_ids

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Returns a list of ZVA engagement surveys.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva_report:read`,`zva_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:read:list_surveys:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, it returns data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: This field is **required** only when the **from** parameter is specified. The end time and date is in the **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, which is the same format as the **from** parameter.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The call's [timezone ID](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/abbreviation-lists/#timezones). The default is **UTC**.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of items returned per page. 
Constraints: Max: 100 Default: 10

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: engagement_ids
parameters.description: A string of engagement IDs separated by ",". Up limit is 2000 characters.

parameters.name: agent_types
parameters.description: The list of (comma-separated) agent types. The default value is **chat**.

parameters.name: survey_ids
parameters.description: A string of survey IDs separated by ",". Up limit is 2000 characters.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`
ZVA engagement surveys successfully returned.

from.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, it returns data from the past 24 hours.

to.description: This field is **required** only when the **from** parameter is specified. The end time and date is in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, which is the same format as the **from** parameter.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call. Constraints: Max: 100 Default: 10

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

engagement_id.description: The engagement ID of the survey.

agent_type.description: The type of the virtual agent.

virtual_agent.description: The name of the virtual agent.

start_time.description: The start time of the survey.

submitted_time.description: The submitted time of the survey.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request Unable to fetch survey results.

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized Missing or invalid authentication.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found Survey results do not exist.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Generates a list of ZVA transcripts.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva_report:read`,`zva_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `zva:read:list_transcripts:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, returns data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: **Required** only when the **from** parameter is specified. The end time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, in the same format as the **from** parameter.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The call's [timezone ID](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/abbreviation-lists/#timezones). The default is **UTC**.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of items returned per page.
Constraints: Maximum - 100, default - 10

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. It returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: engagement_ids
parameters.description: The engagement IDs string separated by ",". The limit is 2000 characters.

parameters.name: agent_types
parameters.description: A list of (comma-separated) agent types. The default value is **chat**.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call. Constraints: Maximum - 100, Default - 10

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

start_time.description: The engagement's start time and date in **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format.

total_duration.description: The duration of the engagement in seconds.

interaction_duration.description: The total number of seconds of interaction between the AI agent and the consumer.

end_time.description: The engagement's end time and date in **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format.

timestamp.description: The message sent time and date in **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format.

kb_articles.description: A list of knowledge base articles involved in generating the message.
